data.event: Columbia is a city in Marion County, Mississippi, which was formed six years before Mississippi was admitted to statehood.

event.title: was incorporated as Columbia on June 25, 1819

data.event: It was incorporated as Columbia on June 25, 1819, becoming the fourth municipality in the state of Mississippi.

event.title: served as the temporary capital of Mississippi from November, 1821

data.event: It served as the temporary capital of Mississippi from November, 1821, when the 5th session of the Mississippi Legislature first met there, until 1822.
It served as the temporary capital of Mississippi from November, 1821, when the 5th session of the Mississippi Legislature first met there, until 1822.

event.title: that year, a special session of the legislature met

data.event: In that year, a special session of the legislature met in Columbia, inaugurating Governor Walter Leake, and selecting LeFleur's Bluff (now Jackson) as the permanent capital.[1] Former Mississippi governor and Columbia native Hugh L. White introduced white squirrels to the area, and they are still common in Columbia City Park.[2] On December 23rd, 2014, an EF3 tornado ripped through areas around Columbia, killing four people and causing widespread damage.

event.title: now Jackson) as the permanent capital.[
